conversations.content: The First Flame: Part One
The Primal Flame is a great power entrusted to a single flame dragon. Long ago, one such mighty creature burned evil to cinders while shining a light upon the weak.
Even after its life was lost, that noble dragon's flame did not disappear.
That flame came to be known as the Primal Flame, and was inherited by a chosen dragon. To earn this right, the dragon would have to complete a grueling trial.
Many flame dragons yearned for that power—and young Prometheus was no exception. He wanted to shine the fires of justice upon the world more than anything.
After hard training, he overcame the trial—and despite his young age, he inherited the Primal Flame. All who heard of this were convinced he would become a legend of the age.
But he soon discovered his power was stronger and more unstable than he knew. For the first time he tried to share it in the aid of men, it burned their village to the ground instead.
The flames roared as they devoured everything, and people ran about trying to escape, screaming and crying. It was a terrifying sight reminiscent of hell itself.
In his efforts to help humanity, he had stolen their happiness. Racked with guilt, he swore to stop all interaction with people.
He never wanted to hurt anyone— or BE hurt—again. He felt he wasn't capable of protecting anyone, and his once-bright passion and yearning burned ever dimmer.
He spent his days in despair... until one fateful meeting.
The First Flame: Part Two
Prometheus obtained great power in order to help people, but ended up harming them instead. He then isolated himself from the world until a chance meeting changed all.
He encountered a group of humans who were battling fiends. The sight confused him greatly—why would they do something so dangerous? Did they not fear being harmed?
When Prometheus asked them this, the boy leading the group laughed. ＂Of course I'm afraid,＂ he chuckled. ＂But the thought of someone ELSE being hurt is scarier—so I fight.＂
The wounds the boy had sustained were almost dazzling to Prometheus— but he was more surprised when the boy extended a hand and asked him to join in his struggle.
Prometheus gazed at the frail hand— one his flames could reduce to ash in an instant—and suddenly found himself remembering the yearnings of his younger days.
He had dreamed of helping others! Not wallowing in his own pain.
He had thought himself strong after gaining his new power. But with a weakened heart that feared pain, he could never protect anything.
Suddenly, he felt a passion that burned like a blaze in a dry forest, and he yearned once more to be strong.
No matter how much sin or sadness he had to bear—and no matter how  much he was hurt—he wanted to protect others as the boy did.
The emotion now burning within him was his true First Flame, and so he accepted the boy's proffered hand.
He felt once more that he could become the next legend—so long as the boy was with him. And thus began the true tale of Prometheus...
